content.description: Up ramp to 1st bolt, up right to 2ed bolt stepping on big flake, up to 3ed bolt. traverse horizontally right to 4th bolt, up and right to slot and bolt then to anchors.
content.location: Right of ramp and above crumbling flake/bulge. 14th route from the left.

climbs.name: Thank God For Your Big Jugs

content.description: Mantel up to the 1st bolt just above ledge, to 2ed bolt on bulge, then mostly straight up. The climbing gets progressively harder until the crux and then you are up in the jugs.
content.location: Starts at the fork at the top end of the fallen, burnt tree. 8th route from the left.

climbs.name: She Fell Flat On Her Face

content.description: 2 bolts up grey water stain. This was bolted ground up, on lead, in sandals...
content.location: Rightmost route directly above the titty print huecos. 15th route from left. Rightmost route.

content.description: Start up 2 bolts and follow tiny seam to black water groove. Follow groove to anchors on the left.
content.protection: 2 bolts and funky gear, chain anchors. I used, in order, a #1 BallNut, #3 DMM offset brass nut, Yellow #2 Metolius TCU, #2 BallNut #5 Black Diamond nut, #1 DMM offset brass nut, and 2 more regular Black Diamond nuts.
content.location: A few feet left of the big black groove. Below 2 bolts. 10th route from left.

content.description: Shares the start with Bolts Or Brass Balls Climb slabby water groove for 10 to 1st bolt of Bolts Or Brass Balls then traverse left via obvious small roof to 2ed bolt. Climb up to 3ed bolt, shoot left hand to the lip 18-2 left of 3ed bolt then either straight up or traverse right on lip and slopey-crimpers and surmount bulge 2-3 right of 3ed bolt. scramble up to 4th bolt and surmount final roof a few feet left of 4th bolt. Traverse right to anchors via undercling in horizontal crack just under anchors.
content.location: Starts from water groove beginning above big detached flake on ground. 2ed route from left.

content.description: Thin slab to the 1st bolt, up and right to the 2ed bolt, up and left to the 3ed bolt on black rock, up and right to the 4th bolt, traverse right to the black nose feature and the 5th bolt, which is where Rock... joins ...Hard, follow the nose to the 6th bolt, then up to the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts and chain anchors. Bolts 5 and 6 are also bolts 7 and 8 on ...Hard.
content.location: Starts from flat ground below the rock ramp and left of a small tree with a sharp, 18 tall stump of a second trunk. 6th route from left.

content.description: Climb up to the eye, then up through bulges. The hardest route on the wall.
content.protection: 6 bolts and chain anchors. Anchors can be reached from The Cave.
content.location: Above fire pit belay area. 12th route from the left.

content.description: Climb up series of little lips and bigger ledges to anchor with 2 Metolius Rap Hangers.
content.location: Starts at base of rock ramp, 5th route from left.

content.description: Use big and smaller hueco to mantel up ledge to high 1st bolt. thin but everything is there. Depending on your height one of the several rock-over high-steps will be the crux, sustained.
content.location: Above big hueco. 9th route from the left.

content.description: Climb ramp to high 1st bolt, diagonally up and right to 2ed bolt, up groove to 3rd bolt, to 4th bolt above the slot, up and left to the anchors.
content.location: Above ramp, 13th route from the left.

content.description: Start up on arching feature in black streak from left/below. Up black streak to horizontal crack and water groove. Continue up vertical crack right of groove and left of bolts.
content.location: Starts in big black streak. 11th route from the left.

content.description: Climb water groove and thin seam up slabby but polished start to the first bolt, then up and right to first juggy lip and 2ed bolt. Turn lip and continue up another slabby section to 3ed bolt and the biggest jug ever! Throw a right foot heel hook or high step move to anchors.
content.location: Starts from water groove beginning above first big detached flake on ground, 3ed route from left.

climbs.name: A Route Named After Our Dog Snoop's Carrot

content.description: Climb up seemingly perfectly placed pseudo-chickenheads, bulges, pseudo-roof, and ledges interspersed with slabby sections.
content.location: above top of rock ramp, 4th route from left.

content.description: Climb up short easy slab section. Continue climbing up the big water groove through the bulge above using funky chicken wings and body stemming and crimps. Fun and unusual climbing for the grade but very short.
content.protection: 4 bolts and chain anchors. The anchors can also be reached by scrambling to them from the top. This was originally lead on super sketchy offset brass micro-nuts, none of which inspired any confidence, which is still an option if 5.7R is your game.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the wall. Starts on the first piece of flat ground after hopping down by the Tiki Head. Climbs short obvious water groove.

content.protection: 3 bolts, one (of the two) Metolius Rap Hanger, 1 bolt, and chain anchors.
content.location: Starts at base of rock ramp, 5th route from left.

content.description: Mostly follows black streak up and left to the black nose where it joins Rock... for the final 2 bolts and anchors. Thin slab climbing through bulges to large feature climbing above the black nose.
content.protection: 8 bolts and chain anchors. Bolts 7 and 8 are also bolts 5 and 6 of Rock...
content.location: Starts on black streak just right of small tree with a sharp 18 tall stump of a second trunk and a head high flake. 7th route from left.

pathTokens: Jenga Tower and Your Mom's Basement, The

content.description: The main wall. climbing on slabs ranging from low angle to slightly overhanging. Enough routes for a nice day or two. South facing so it can get hot, however the wall gets shade from 4:00ish to sundown.
